title.narrative: Danish Regional Sahel Peace and Stabilisation Programme 2013-2017

description.narrative:
The Sahel region is among the worlds poorest with a security situation that has deteriorated over the past years, and the development in Mali is an apparent evidence of the instability in the region. The current situation reflects well how regional, national and local circumstances are interdependent and requires stabilisation efforts that address both the causes of the conflicts and their influence across the region, in order to promote sustainable development and security.
To address these issues, the Danish government has launched The Danish Regional Sahel Peace and Stabilization Programme 2013-2017. The programme¿s overall objective is to contribute to international efforts to increase stability in the Sahel region. The Sahel Programme focuses on activities in Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger.
The root causes for the present crisis in the Sahel are due to several intertwined factors, notably a) chronic underdevelopment, b) continuous humanitarian crises, c) underlying political and security concerns. The latter political and security concerns may be summarised in three headlines: 1) Unresolved conflicts, 2) lack of security, and 3) the rise of violent extremism and organised crime.
Accordingly the Sahel programme has been designed around these three headlines and has three components: Contribute to enhanced mediation and conflict resolution, where the focus is especially on local level mediation and conflict resolution, as the local conflicts can often act as triggers or drivers of the larger, national and regional conflicts. Contribute to improved security, where the focus is on enhancing the democratic control of the security sector in Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso by building capacity of Parliaments, civil society and Ministries of Defence. Contribute to the countering of violent extremism and organised crime, where the focus will be on new ways to counter violent extremism and on improving the regional cooperation on combatting organised crime.
